publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5412 Cathie Craigie: Commending Whitelees Primary School—That the Parliament congratulates and commends Whitelees Primary in Abronhill, Cumbernauld, Scotland’s number one eco-friendly primary school, on the launch of its climate change song; recognises that more educational facilities should be highlighting the problems posed by global warming to their pupils and the surrounding community, and thanks the children and staff of Whitelees for their continual commitment to protecting the environment.

S3M-5412 Commending Whitelees Primary School (lodged on 14 December 2009) Mary Mulligan*, James Kelly*, Robin Harper*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Jackie Baillie*, Elaine Smith*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Ken Macintosh*, John Park*, Des McNulty*, Bill Kidd*, Christina McKelvie*
S3M-5412 Commending Whitelees Primary School (lodged on 14 December 2009) Karen Whitefield*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-5412 Commending Whitelees Primary School (lodged on 14 December 2009) Cathy Peattie*, Marilyn Livingstone*

S3M-5412 Cathie Craigie: Commending Whitelees Primary School—That the Parliament congratulates and commends Whitelees Primary in Abronhill, Cumbernauld, Scotland’s number one eco-friendly primary school, on the launch of its climate change song; recognises that more educational facilities should be highlighting the problems posed by global warming to their pupils and the surrounding community, and thanks the children and staff of Whitelees for their continual commitment to protecting the environment. Supported by: Mary Mulligan, James Kelly, Robin Harper, Mr Frank McAveety, Jackie Baillie, Elaine Smith, Hugh O’Donnell, Ken Macintosh, John Park, Des McNulty, Bill Kidd, Christina McKelvie, Karen Whitefield, Hugh Henry, Cathy Peattie, Marilyn Livingstone, Trish Godman*
